title: Atomic Layer Deposition (ALD) Process
description: A schema representing the steps and parameters involved in setting up and verifying a plasma-assisted Atomic Layer Deposition process for various materials, including transition metal-doped ZnO layers.

ALDMethod.description: The specific ALD technique used, e.g., thermal ALD, plasma-enhanced ALD.

MaterialDeposited.description: The material being deposited, including metals, metal oxides, and doped materials such as transition metal-doped ZnO.

Substrate.description: Details about the substrate used for deposition.

Type.description: Type of substrate, e.g., Si(100) with native oxide layer.

SeedLayer.description: Details about the seed layer used, if any.

Material.description: Material of the seed layer, e.g., Iridium.

Thickness.description: Thickness of the seed layer in nm.

ProcessParameters.description: Parameters that define the conditions and settings of the ALD process.

DepositionTemperature.description: Temperature at which the ALD process is carried out, typically in °C.

VacuumCondition.description: Vacuum conditions used during the ALD process.

PlasmaConditions.description: Specific conditions related to the plasma used in the ALD process, including type, power, duration, species, gas flow, and pressure.

GasFlow.description: Flow rate of the plasma gas, typically in sccm.

Pressure.description: Pressure of the plasma in mTorr.

GasResidenceTime.description: The residence time of the gas in the reactor, typically in seconds, affecting the redeposition rate.

LowTemperatureGrowth.description: Indicates if the process supports growth at low temperatures.

LowTemperatureLimit.description: Lowest successful deposition temperature achieved, in °C.

OxygenSource.description: Type of oxygen source used, e.g., Pure Oxygen, Air.

DiagnosticTechniques.description: List of diagnostic techniques used to monitor the ALD process.

FilmProperties.description: Properties of the deposited film, including impurity content, wet-etch rates, magneto-optical properties, and dielectric properties.

ImpurityContent.description: Content of impurities such as Carbon and Oxygen in the film.

WetEtchRate.description: Wet etch rate of the film in nm/min, indicating film resistance.

MagnetoOpticalProperties.description: Magneto-optical properties such as Kerr effect and coercivity.

KerrEffect.description: Kerr rotation angle in degrees, indicating the magneto-optical response.

Coercivity.description: Coercivity in Oersted, indicating the resistance to demagnetization.

DielectricProperties.description: Dielectric properties such as dielectric constant and loss.

DielectricLoss.description: Dielectric loss of the film, indicating energy dissipation as heat.

Precursor.description: Details about the precursor used in the ALD process.

PulseTime.description: Time for which the precursor is pulsed into the reactor, typically in seconds.

FlowRate.description: Flow rate of the precursor, typically in sccm.
